alert.note: Alert for Barry (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 04 at 3:07PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Missouri, including the following counties, Barry, Lawrence and Stone. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 307 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following low water crossings... Little Crane Creek at Old Wire Road, Flat Creek at Highway U, Flat Creek at Highway Y, Flat Creek at Highway C and Rockhouse Creek at Farm Road 2145. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aurora, Cassville, Marionville, Crane, Purdy, Verona, Galena and Butterfield. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
